get.description: Transform an individual server into a response that can be consumed by a client using the API.
Returns a listing of files in a given directory.
Return the contents of a specified file for the user.
Generates a one-time token with a link that the user can use to download a given file.

put.description: Renames a file on the remote machine.

post.description: Copies a file on the server.
Writes the contents of the specified file to the server.
Deletes files or folders for the server in the given root directory.
Creates a new folder on the server.
Updates file permissions for file(s) in the given root directory.
Requests that a file be downloaded from a remote location by daemon.

get.description: Returns all the schedules belonging to a given server.

post.description: Store a new schedule for a server.

get.description: Returns a specific schedule for the server.

post.description: Updates a given schedule with the new data provided.

delete.description: Deletes a schedule and it's associated tasks.

post.description:
Executes a given schedule immediately rather than waiting on it's normally scheduled time
to pass. This does not care about the schedule state.
Send a command to a running server.

get.description: Returns an url where files can be uploaded to.

post.description: Create a new task for a given schedule and store it in the database.
Updates a given task for a server.

delete.description:
Delete a given task for a schedule. If there are subsequent tasks stored in the database
for this schedule their sequence IDs are decremented properly.

post.description: Send a power action to a server.

get.description:
Return the current resource utilization for a server. This value is cached for up to
20 seconds at a time to ensure that repeated requests to this endpoint do not cause
a flood of unnecessary API calls.

Return all the servers available to the client making the API
request, including servers the user has access to as a subuser.
Returns all the subuser permissions available on the system.
Returns the activity logs for a server.

Lists all the allocations available to a server and whether
they are currently assigned as the primary for this server.

post.description: Set the notes for the allocation for a server.
Set the primary allocation for a server.

delete.description: Delete an allocation from a server.

post.description: Set the primary allocation for a server.

get.description: Returns all the backups for a given server instance in a paginated result set.

post.description: Starts the backup process for a server.

get.description: Returns information about a single backup.

delete.description:
Deletes a backup from the panel as well as the remote source where it is currently
being stored.

get.description:
Download the backup for a given server instance. For daemon local files, the file
will be streamed back through the Panel. For AWS S3 files, a signed URL will be generated
which the user is redirected to.

put.description: Updates the name of a backup for a server instance.

post.description: Toggles the lock status of a given backup for a server.

Handles restoring a backup by making a request to the daemon instance telling it
to begin the process of finding (or downloading) the backup and unpacking it
over the server files.

If the "truncate" flag is passed through in this request then all the
files that currently exist on the server will be deleted before restoring.
Otherwise, the archive will simply be unpacked over the existing files.

get.description: Return all the databases that belong to the given server.

post.description: Create a new database for the given server and return it.

Rotates the password for the given server model and returns a fresh instance to
the caller.

delete.description: Removes a database from the server.

post.description: Renames a server.
Reinstalls the server on the daemon.

put.description: Changes the Docker image in use by the server.

get.description: Returns the startup information for the server including all the variables.

put.description: Updates a single variable for a server.

get.description: Return the users associated with this server instance.

post.description: Create a new subuser for the given server.

get.description: Returns a single subuser associated with this server instance.

post.description: Update a given subuser in the system for the server.

delete.description: Removes a subusers from a server's assignment.

get.description:
Generates a one-time token that is sent along in every websocket call to the Daemon.
This is a signed JWT that the Daemon then uses to verify the user's identity, and
allows us to continually renew this token and avoid users maintaining sessions wrongly,
as well as ensure that user's only perform actions they're allowed to.

put.description: Update the authenticated user's email address.

Update the authenticated user's password. All existing sessions will be logged
out immediately.

get.description: Returns a paginated set of the user's activity logs.
Returns all the API keys that exist for the given client.

post.description: Store a new API key for a user's account.

get.description: Returns all the SSH keys that have been configured for the logged-in user account.

post.description: Stores a new SSH key for the authenticated user's account.

delete.description: Deletes an SSH key from the user's account.

errors.description: A detailed description of each field that failed validation.
